        public CPT(java.util.Set<Probability> table)

    • Method Detail

      • update

        protected void update(Values values,
                      java.lang.String variableName)
        It's possible to assume values.get(values.size()) as the hidden value. This function for update the CPT. That's mean that a probability is added to the table. I.e, if the table was : P(B=true) = 0.9, now the table is P(B=true)=0.9 and P(B=false)=0.1.
        Parameters:
        values -
        variableName -

      • getSum

        protected double getSum()
        This function returns the sum of all the probability of the table. After the update, the return of this function must be 1.
        Returns:
        the sum

      • getStable

        protected java.util.Set<Event> getStable()
        This method returns all the stable Event. The meaning of stable event is the event of the table that doesn't change their Value.
        Returns:
        a set of Event

      • getProbability

        protected double getProbability(Value value)
        This method return the probability of the table for a given Value. Attention, obviously since the value of the stable event doesn't change, here the Value required is the value of the dynamic event. This function must never return 0.0, only one case of error. This make the mistake easily recognized.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        the probability

      • matchStaticEvent

        protected boolean matchStaticEvent(java.util.List<Event> parentsValues)
        This function test if the the given list of Event which include Value of the parents are the same that the static/stable Value. Attention, there is a match if and only if all the Value and all the variable name of the parents match wit the static event of the table.
        Parameters:
        parentsValues -
        Returns:
        true if there is a match, else false.

      • getTable

        public java.util.Set<Probability> getTable()
        Returns:
        the table
